page.title: 12A DAY IN THE LIFE OF MATTHEW
page.content: I wake up at 7.30, throw back my sheets, climb out of my bunk bed, take off my cotton pyjamas and get dressed. I wear cords which are my favourite sort of trousers. I help Mum by laying the breakfast table. Meanwhile Mum does the animals because Dad is away working on a North Sea oilrig and offshore drilling. For breakfast I have cornflakes and oats. We have our own milk because we keep two nanny goats, Abigail and Chloe. After breakfast I clear the table and put the food back in the larder or the fridge. Our house is quite old with an old Rayburn stove fixed in the wall. I get washed next and ready for school. I cycle to school on my racing bike. When I arrive there's still five minutes before the bell.
